channel.title: Vista on Sad Robot
channel.description: Recent content in Vista on Sad Robot

item.title: Running 32-bit Remote Desktop Connection on Windows 64 bit
item.description: On Windows Vista 64 and Windows 7 64, there is a 32 bit version of Remote Desktop Connection (Microsoft Terminal Services Client, mstsc.exe) in %SystemRoot%SysWOW64. Running this mstsc.exe will launch the 32 bit process but it will instantly launch the 64-bit mstsc.exe from System32 and shut itself down. This makes it impossible to run Remote Desktop Connection 32 bit. This is a problem when you have 32 bit Terminal Services add-ins (which won’t run under 64 bit).
